intro: Cyrtandra mcgregorii, commonly known as McGregor's cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. The plant is typically found growing in shaded, moist habitats such as rainforests or along stream banks. It has heart-shaped leaves and produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
